skill.name: clojure-review
skill.description: Review Clojure and ClojureScript code changes for compliance with Metabase coding standards, style violations, and code quality issues. Use when reviewing pull requests or diffs containing Clojure/ClojureScript code.
skill.summary: Review Clojure and ClojureScript code changes for compliance with Metabase coding standards, style v...

security_audit.summary: The skill contains static review guidance only. No code execution, file access, or network activity is present.

content.user_title: Review Clojure diffs for Metabase style
content.value_statement: Clojure reviews can miss consistent style and API rules. This skill applies Metabase conventions so you can flag issues fast.
actual_capabilities: Identify naming rule violations such as missing bang for side effects
Flag missing docstrings for public vars in source namespaces
Check API endpoint conventions like singular routes and schema presence
Review test naming and parallel test annotations
Detect module namespace pattern mismatches for OSS and EE
limitations: Does not run linters or execute code
Cannot validate runtime behavior or performance
Relies on provided diffs and context only
No automatic fixes or patch output

use_cases.title: Pre-PR self check
use_cases.description: Scan your diff for Metabase style violations before opening a pull request.

use_cases.title: Fast standards audit
use_cases.description: Spot naming, docstring, and API convention issues during code review.

use_cases.title: Consistency enforcement
use_cases.description: Ensure module, MBQL, and database patterns follow project rules.

prompt_templates.title: Quick style scan
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this Clojure diff for Metabase style violations only. List each issue with a brief fix suggestion.

prompt_templates.title: API conventions check
prompt_templates.prompt: Check this PR for REST API rules, including route naming, schemas, and query parameter casing.

prompt_templates.title: Test hygiene review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review these new tests for naming, parallel markers, and separation of cases.

prompt_templates.title: Full standards audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Audit this Clojure and ClojureScript diff against Metabase coding standards and list all violations.

output_examples.input: Review this diff for Metabase style issues and API conventions.
output: Public var lacks docstring in src namespace; add a docstring describing purpose and inputs.
Route uses plural resource; change to singular to match API conventions.
Side effect function name missing exclamation mark; rename to include !.

best_practices: Provide the full diff and relevant context for each namespace.
Call out whether changes touch API endpoints or drivers.
Ask for a focused review scope when time is limited.
anti_patterns: Asking for general praise or approval comments.
Providing no diff or only a file list.
Mixing unrelated language files in the same review request.

faq.question: What repositories does this skill support?
faq.answer: It is tuned for Metabase Clojure and ClojureScript conventions and works best on similar codebases.

faq.question: What are the main limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It does not execute code or run linters, so it only checks style and rules in the provided diff.

faq.question: Can I integrate it into my review workflow?
faq.answer: Yes, paste PR diffs or patch sections and ask for focused checks like API or tests.

faq.question: Does it access my local files or secrets?
faq.answer: No, it only analyzes the text you provide in the conversation.

faq.question: What should I do if the output seems incomplete?
faq.answer: Provide missing context, larger diffs, or clarify which rules you want enforced.

faq.question: How does it compare to automated linters?
faq.answer: It complements linters by checking project-specific conventions and review guidance.
